thread.title: Up at Night and Worrying About the Country

author: wsjcom
title: Up at Night and Worrying About the Country
text: Regarding Thomas Lee’s “What’s Keeping David McCullough From Sleeping” (op-ed, March 26) in which he discusses Mr. McCullough’s sleeplessness from worrying about our country, I was reading his “John Adams” when we suffered the shock and heartbreak of 9/11. His skill portraying the great tragedies of our just-forming country and the heroism and character of Adams and others put in perspective the magnitude of what terror and adversity can truly be. It gave great comfort that we would overcome such a treacherous assault. If we put Mr. McCullough’s books in the hands of younger generations to learn why things have turned...
